data.organization: Immigrant Home Learning Program (IHELP) formally, Immigrant & Refugee Women's Program (IRWP)
data.details: We will have regular office hours open for notarizing ballots starting the week of September 28th and running through November 3rd. Tuesdays, Thursdays, Fridays 9am-2pm  We also plan to have additional drives that we will be planning in the coming week.
We have a notary every Wednesday from 5PM - 8:30PM and every Saturday from 9AM to 12PM. Through 10/21/20.

Here is the list of all the times we have a DRIVE-THRU NOTARY:  October 4: 10:00am-2:00pm  October 7: 10:00am-2:00pm  October 9: 10:00am-2:00pm  October 11: 10:00am-2:00pm October 13: 5:00-7:00pm October 15: 10:00am-2:00pm October 18: 10:00am-2:00pm October 19 10:00am-2:00pm October 21: 5:00-7:00pm October 23: 10:00am-2:00pm October 25: 10:00am-2:00pm October 27: 10:00am-2:00pm October 29: 10:00am-2:00pm November 1: 10:00am-2:00pm Wear a mask, bring ID, fill out your ballot but don't sign it or seal the envelope. Bring a pen.

data.organization: League of Women Voters of Metro St. Louis
data.details: Monday through Friday 9:30-3:30, Saturdays in October from 10-Noon and 1 to 3.

data.details: Also available most days (8-5) by email to meet at this location. I'm the notary and will be at this location. Wanted you to know our company is willing to help.

Notary Public Andrea Clark will notarize mail-in and absentee ballots beginning at 5:30.  The Mound City Slickers will perform from 6 p.m. until dark.  Bring a lawn chair, beverage, ballot and I.D. to Bellerive Blvd.
data.location: 911 Bellerive Blvd., St. Louis MO, MO 63111

We are hosting voter registration and ballot notarization services at the museum on Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays from September 17–October 10, but would like to expand through October 24. We're just looking for help on the Saturday shifts

Our notary effort will be at 10 libraries in metro St. Louis: Schlafly, Barr, Julia Davis and Carpenter in STL City; Headquarters, Weber Road, Prairie Village and Natural Bridge; and University City and Ferguson independent branches. We will be there during regular business hours from October 19-29 (except Sundays). We will be adhering to all safety protocols established by the libraries.
